B.title: Aggregate Feature
B.description:
'minecraft:aggregate_feature` places a collection of features in an arbitary order. All features in the collection use the same input position. Features should not depend on each other, as there is no guarantee on the order the features will be placed.
 Succeeds if: At lease one feature is placed successfully.
 Fails if: All features fail to be placed.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

features.title: Features
features.description: Collection of features to be placed one by one. No guarantee of order. All features use the same input position.

items.title: Feature
items.description: UNDOCUMENTATED

early_out.title: Early Out
early_out.description: LIKELY TO BE CHANGED: Do not continue placing features once either the first success or first failure has occurred.

D.title: Beards And Shavers
D.description:
`minecraft:beards_and_shavers` will build a `beard` or `shave` out space so as to provide a clear space for a feature to place.
Succeeds if: a beard/shave is made (this should always happen).
Fails if: will always return placement pos, but interior feature placement not guaranteed.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

places_feature.title: Places Feature
places_feature.description: Named reference of feature to be placed.

surface_block_type.title: Surface Block Type
surface_block_type.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

subsurface_block_type.title: Subsurface Block Type
subsurface_block_type.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

G.title: Molang Number
G.description: The minecraft molang definition that results in a float

F.title: Cave Carver Feature
F.description: `minecraft:cave_carver_feature` carves a cave through the world in the current chunk, and in every chunk around the current chunk in an 8 radial pattern. This feature will also only work when placed specifically in the pass "pregeneration_pass".

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

fill_with.title: Fill with
fill_with.description: Reference to the block to fill the cave with.

width_modifier.title: Width modifier
width_modifier.description: How many blocks to increase the cave radius by, from the center point of the cave.

H.title: Conditional List
H.description:
`minecraft:conditional_list` Places the first suitable feature within a collection.
These conditional features will be evaluated in order.
Succeeds if: A condition is successfully resolved.
Fails if: No condition is successfully resolved.
Example use: assigning a feature to an expression

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

conditional_features.title: Conditional Features
conditional_features.description: Array of Features, and their associated Conditions, for attempted placement. These features will be evaluated as ordered.

items.title: Conditional Feature
items.description: A Feature, and their associated Conditions, for attempted placement. These features will be evaluated as ordered.

early_out_scheme.title: Early out scheme
early_out_scheme.description: Denote whether placement should end on first successful placement or first passed condition.

J.title: Geode Feature
J.description:
`minecraft:geode_feature` generates a rock formation to simulate a geode. Each layer of, and block within, the geode can be replaced.
Succeeds if: At least one block within the geode is placed.
Fails if: All blocks within the geode fail to be placed.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

filler.title: Filler
filler.description: The block to fill the inside of the geode.

inner_layer.title: Inner layer
inner_layer.description: The block that forms the inside layer of the geode shell.

alternate_inner_layer.title: Alternate inner layer
alternate_inner_layer.description: The block that has a chance of generating instead of inner_layer.

middle_layer.title: Middle layer
middle_layer.description: The block that forms the middle layer of the geode shell.

outer_layer.title: Outer layer
outer_layer.description: The block that forms the outer shell of the geode.

inner_placements.title: Inner placements
inner_placements.description: A list of blocks that may be replaced during placement. Omit this field to allow any block to be replaced.

items.title: Block reference
items.description: A block that may be replaced during placement

min_outer_wall_distance.title: Min Outer Wall Distance
min_outer_wall_distance.description: The minimum distance each distribution point must be from the outer wall. [0,10]

max_outer_wall_distance.title: Max Outer Wall Distance
max_outer_wall_distance.description: The maximum distance each distribution point can be from the outer wall. [0,20]

min_distribution_points.title: Min Distribution Points
min_distribution_points.description: The minimum number of points inside the distance field that can get generated. The distance field is the area consisting of all points with a minimum distance to all destribution points. [0,10]

max_distribution_points.title: Max Distribution Points
max_distribution_points.description: The maximum number of points inside the distance field that can get generated. The distance field is the area consisting of all points with a minimum distance to all destribution points. [0,20]

min_point_offset.title: Min Point Offset
min_point_offset.description: The lowest possible value of random offset applied to the position of each distribution point. [0,10]

max_point_offset.title: Max Point Offset
max_point_offset.description: The highest possible value of random offset applied to the position of each distribution point. [0,10]

max_radius.title: Max Radius
max_radius.description: The maximum possible radius of the geode generated.

crack_point_offset.title: Crack Point Offset
crack_point_offset.description: An offset applied to each distribution point that forms the geode crack opening. [0,10]

generate_crack_chance.title: Generate Crack Chance
generate_crack_chance.description: The likelihood of a geode generating with a crack in its shell. [0,1]

base_crack_size.title: Base Crack Size
base_crack_size.description: How large the crack opening of the geode should be when generated. [0,5]

noise_multiplier.title: Noise Multiplier
noise_multiplier.description: A multiplier applied to the noise that is applied to the distribution points within the geode. Higher = more noisy.

use_potential_placements_chance.title: Use Potential Placements Chance
use_potential_placements_chance.description: The likelihood that a special block will be placed on the inside of the geode. [0,1]

use_alternate_layer0_chance.title: Use Alternate Layer0 Chance
use_alternate_layer0_chance.description: The likelihood that a block in the innermost layer of the geode will be replaced with an alternate option. [0,1]

placements_require_layer0_alternate.title: Placements Require Layer0 Alternate
placements_require_layer0_alternate.description: If true, the potential placement block will only be placed on the alternate layer0 blocks that get placed. Potential placement blocks are blocks that depend on the existance of another block to be placed. The latter are the layer0 alternate blocks.

invalid_blocks_threshold.title: Invalid Blocks Threshold
invalid_blocks_threshold.description: The threshold of invalid blocks for a geode to have a distribution point in before it aborts generation entirely.

items.title: Blocks
items.description: Collection of weighted block descriptor that placement will select from for the plant.

items.title: Plant Body Block
items.description: Plant body block.

items.title: Weight
items.description: Weight used in random selection. Value is relative to other weights in the collection.

BA.title: Growing Plant Feature
BA.description:
`minecraft:growing_plant_feature` places a growing plant in the world. A growing plant is a column that is anchored either to the ceiling or the floor, based on its growth direction.
The growing plant has a body and a head, where the head is the tip of the plant, and the body consists of the remainder blocks.
This feature can be used to define growing plants with variable body and head blocks, e.g. Cave Vines.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

age.title: Age
age.description: Age of the head of the plant.

height_distribution.title: Height distribution
height_distribution.description: Collection of weighted heights that placement will select from.

items.title: Height distribution
items.description: Collection of weighted heights that placement will select from.

items.title: Plant Height
items.description: Plant height.

items.title: Weight
items.description: Weight used in random selection. Value is relative to other weights in the collection.

growth_direction.title: Growth Direction
growth_direction.description: Direction that the plant grows towards. Valid values: UP and DOWN

body_blocks.title: Body Blocks
body_blocks.description: Collection of weighted block descriptor that placement will select from for the body of the plant.

head_blocks.title: Head Blocks
head_blocks.description: Collection of weighted block descriptor that placement will select from for the body of the plant.

allow_water.title: Allow Water
allow_water.description: Plant blocks can be placed in water.

BB.title: Hell Cave Carver Feature
BB.description: `minecraft:hell_cave_carver_feature` carves a cave through the Nether in the current chunk, and in every chunk around the current chunk in an 8 radial pattern.This feature will also only work when placed specifically in the pass `pregeneration_pass`.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

fill_with.title: Identifier
fill_with.description: Reference to the block to fill the cave with.

width_modifier.title: Identifier
width_modifier.description: How many blocks to increase the cave radius by, from the center point of the cave.

BC.title: Multiface Feature
BC.description:
`minecraft:multiface_feature` places one or a few multiface blocks on floors/walls/ceilings. Despite the name, any block can be placed by this feature. During placement, existing world blocks are checked to see if this feature can be placed on them based on the list provided in the `can_place_on` field. If no `can_replace_on` field is specified, the `place_block` block can be placed on any existing block.
This feature will also try to spread the `place_block` block around the location in world the feature is placed.
Succeeds if: At least one block is successfully placed.
Fails if: All block placements fail.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

places_block.title: Places Block
places_block.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

search_range.title: Search Range
search_range.description: How far, in blocks, this feature can search for a valid position to place.

can_place_on_floor.title: Can Place On Floor
can_place_on_floor.description: Can this feature be placed on the ground (top face of a block)?

can_place_on_ceiling.title: Can Place On Ceiling
can_place_on_ceiling.description: Can this feature be placed on the ceiling (bottom face of a block)?

can_place_on_wall.title: Can Place On Wall
can_place_on_wall.description: Can this feature be placed on the wall (side faces of a block)?

chance_of_spreading.title: Chance of Spreading
chance_of_spreading.description: For each block placed by this feature, how likely will that block spread to another?

can_place_on.title: Can Place On
can_place_on.description: How far, in blocks, this feature can search for a valid position to place.

items.title: Block
items.description: A list of blocks that the block in this feature can be placed on. Omit this field to allow any block to be placed on.

BD.title: Ore Feature
BD.description:
`minecraft:ore_feature` places a vein of blocks to simulate ore deposits. Despite the name, any block can be placed by this feature. During placement, existing world blocks are checked to see if they can be replaced by the new ore block based on the list provided in the `may_replace` field of a `replace_rules` entry. If no `may_replace` field is specified in a `replace_rule` entry, the ore block can replace any existing block.
Succeeds if: At least one ore block is successfully placed.
Fails if: All ore block placements fail.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of blocks to be placed.

replace_rules.title: Replace Rules
replace_rules.description: Collection of replace rules that will be checked in order of definition. If a rule is resolved, the rest will not be resolved for that block position.

items.title: Repalce Rule
items.description: If a rule is resolved, the rest will not be resolved for that block position.

places_block.title: Places Block
places_block.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

may_replace.title: May replace
may_replace.description: A list of blocks that may be replaced during placement. Omit this field to allow any block to be replaced.

BE.title: Rect Layout
BE.description:
`minecraft:rect_layout` places a vein of blocks to simulate ore deposits. Despite the name, any block can be placed by this feature. During placement, existing world blocks are checked to see if they can be replaced by the new ore block based on the list provided in the `may_replace` field of a `replace_rules` entry. If no `may_replace` field is specified in a `replace_rule` entry, the ore block can replace any existing block.
Succeeds if: At least one ore block is successfully placed.
Fails if: All ore block placements fail.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

ratio_of_empty_space.title: Ratio Of Empty Space
ratio_of_empty_space.description: Ratio of a Chunk to be filled with empty space rather than features.

items.title: Feature Area
items.description: UNDOCUMENTATED

BF.title: Rect Layout
BF.description:
`minecraft:scan_surface` scans the surface of a Chunk, calling place() on the surface of each block column.
Succeeds if: A Feature was successfully placed during the scan.
Fails if: No Feature was placed during the course of the scan.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

scan_surface_feature.title: Scan Surface Feature
scan_surface_feature.description: Named reference of feature to be placed

oneOf.description: Expression for the coordinate (evaluated each iteration). Mutually exclusive with random distribution object below.
Distribution for the coordinate (evaluated each iteration). Mutually exclusive with Molang expression above.

distribution.title: Distribution
distribution.description: Type of distribution - uniform random, gaussian (centered in the range), or grid (either fixed-step or jittered)

step_size.title: Step Size
step_size.description: When the distribution type is grid, defines the distance between steps along this axis

grid_offset.title: Step Size
grid_offset.description: When the distribution type is grid, defines the offset along this axis

items.title: Lower bound
items.description: Lower bound (inclusive) of the scatter range, as an offset from the input point to scatter around

items.title: Upper bound
items.description: Upper bound (inclusive) of the scatter range, as an offset from the input point to scatter around

BG.title: Scatter Feature
BG.description:
`minecraft:scatter_feature` scatters a feature throughout a chunk. The `x`, `y`, and `z` fields are per-coordinate parameters.
Note that coordinates represent an offset from the input position, not an absolute position. Coordinates may be a single value, a random distribution, or molang expression that resolves to a numeric value. The `coordinate_eval_order` field is provided for finer control of coordinate resolution (particularly when using the `grid` distribution). `iterations` controls how many individual placements should occur if the `scatter_chance` check succeeds. The `scatter_chance` check happens once, so either all placements will run or none will.
Succeeds if: At least one feature placement succeeds.
Fails if: All feature placements fail.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

places_feature.title: Places Feature
places_feature.description: Named reference of feature to be placed

project_input_to_floor.title: Project Input To Floor
project_input_to_floor.description: If true, snaps the y-value of the scattered position to the terrain heightmap. If false or unset, y-value is unmodified.

iterations.title: Iterations
iterations.description: Number of scattered positions to generate

oneOf.description: Probability numerator / denominator that this scatter will occur.  Not evaluated each iteration; either no iterations will run, or all will.
Probability (0-100] that this scatter will occur. Not evaluated each iteration; either no iterations will run, or all will.

coordinate_eval_order.title: coordinate_eval_order
coordinate_eval_order.description: The order in which coordinates will be evaluated. Should be used when a coordinate depends on another. If omitted, defaults to `xzy`.

BH.title: Search Feature
BH.description:
`minecraft:search_feature` sweeps a volume searching for a valid placement location for its referenced feature. The `search_volume` field specifies the axis-aligned bounding box that defines the boundaries of the search. The search sweeps along the axis defined by the `search_axis` field, layer by layer. For example, if `search_axis` = '-x', blocks with greater x values will be checked before blocks with lower x values. Each layer is searched from the bottom-left to the top-right before moving to the next layer along the axis. By default, only one valid position must be found, but this can be altered by specifying the `required_successes` field. If fewer than the required successes are found, no placement will occur.
Succeeds if: The number of valid positions is equal to the value specified by `required_successes`.
Fails if: The number of valid positions is less than the value specified by `required_successes`.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

places_feature.title: Places Feature
places_feature.description: Named reference of feature to be placed

search_volume.title: Places Feature
search_volume.description: Axis-aligned bounding box that will be searched for valid placement positions. Expressed as offsets from the input position.

max.title: Max
max.description: Maximum extent of the bounding volume expressed as [ x, y, z ]

min.title: Min
min.description: Maxium extent of the bounding volume expressed as [ x, y, z ]

search_axis.title: Search Axis
search_axis.description: Axis that the search will sweep along through the `search_volume`

required_successes.title: Required successes
required_successes.description: Number of valid positions the search must find in order to place the referenced feature

BI.title: Sequence Feature
BI.description:
`minecraft:sequence_feature` places a collection of features sequentially, in the order they appear in data. The output position of the previous feature is used as the input position for the next. For example, a tree feature is placed at (0, 0, 0) and places blocks up to (0, 10, 0). The next feature in the sequence begins at (0, 10, 0).
Succeeds if: All features in the sequence are successfully placed.
Fails if: Any feature in the sequence fails to be placed. Features that have not yet been placed at the time of failure are skipped.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

features.title: Features
features.description: List of features to be placed in sequence. The output position of the previous feature is used as the input position to the next.

items.title: Feature
items.description: A feature to be placed in sequence. The output position of the previous feature is used as the input position to the next.

items.title: UNDOCUMENTATED
items.description: UNDOCUMENTATED

BJ.title: Single Block Feature
BJ.description:
`minecraft:single_block_feature` places a single block in the world. The `may_place_on` and `may_replace` fields are allowlists which specify where the block can be placed. If these fields are omitted, the block can be placed anywhere. The block's internal survivability and placement rules can optionally be enforced with the `enforce_survivability_rules` and `enforce_placement_rules` fields. These rules are specified per-block and are typically designed to produce high quality gameplay or natural behavior. However, enabling this enforcement may make it harder to debug placement failures.
 Succeeds if: The block is successfully placed in the world.
 Fails if: The block fails to be placed.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

places_block.title: Places block
places_block.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

enforce_placement_rules.title: Enforce Placement Rules
enforce_placement_rules.description: If true, enforce the block's canPlace check.

enforce_survivability_rules.title: Enforce Survivability Rules
enforce_survivability_rules.description: If true, enforce the block's canSurvive check.

auto_rotate.title: Auto rotate
auto_rotate.description: Automatically rotate the block to attach sensibly.

may_replace.title: May replace
may_replace.description: A list of blocks that may be replaced during placement. Omit this field to allow any block to be replaced.

items.title: Block
items.description: A block that may be replaced during placement. Omit this field to allow any block to be replaced.

CA.title: Snap To Surface Feature
CA.description:
`minecraft:snap_to_surface_feature` snaps the y-value of a feature placement pos to the floor or the ceiling within the provided `vertical_search_range`. The placement biome is preserved. 
If the snap position goes outside of the placement biome, placement will fail.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

feature_to_snap.title: Feature to snap
feature_to_snap.description: Named reference of feature to be snapped

vertical_search_range.title: Vertical search range
vertical_search_range.description: Range to search for a floor or ceiling for snaping the feature.

surface.title: Surface
surface.description: Defines the surface that the y-value of the placement position will be snapped to. Valid values: `ceiling` and `floor'

CB.title: Structure Template Feature
CB.description:
`minecraft:structure_template_feature` places a structure in the world. The structure must be stored as a .mcstructure file in the `structures` subdirectory of a behavior pack. It is possible to reference structures that are part of other behavior packs, they do not need to come from the same behavior pack as this feature. Constraints can be defined to specify where the structure is allowed to be placed. During placement, the feature will search for a position within the 'adjustment_radius' that satisfies all constraints. If none are found, the structure will not be placed.
Succeeds if: The structure is placed in the world.
Fails if: The structure fails to be placed within the world.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

structure_name.title: Structure Name
structure_name.description: Reference to the structure to be placed.

adjustment_radius.title: Adjustment Radius
adjustment_radius.description: How far the structure is allowed to move when searching for a valid placement position. Search is radial, stopping when the nearest valid position is found. Defaults to 0 if omitted.

facing_direction.title: Facing Direction
facing_direction.description: Direction the structure will face when placed in the world. Defaults to `random` if omitted.

constraints.description: Specific constraints that must be satisfied when placing this structure.

grounded.title: Grounded
grounded.description: When specified, ensures the structure is on the ground.

unburied.title: Unburied
unburied.description: When specified, ensures the structure has air above it.

block_intersection.title: Unburied
block_intersection.description: When specified, ensures the structure has air above it.

block_allowlist.title: Block Allowlist
block_allowlist.description: List of blocks the owning structure is allowed to intersect with.

block_whitelist.title: Block Whitelist
block_whitelist.description: List of blocks the owning structure is allowed to intersect with.

CE.title: Underwater Cave Carver Feature
CE.description:
'minecraft:underwater_cave_carver_feature' carves a cave through the world in the current chunk, and in every chunk around the current chunk in an 8 radial pattern.This feature will specifically target creating caves only below sea level.
This feature will also only work when placed specifically in the pass "pregeneration_pass".

identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

replace_air_with.title: Replace air with

CF.description: Feature type `minecraft:vegetation_patch_feature` has not yet been documented.

CG.title: Weighted Random Feature
CG.description:
'minecraft:weighted_random_feature' randomly selects and places a feature based on a weight value. Weights are relative, with higher values making selection more likely.
Succeeds if: The selected feature is placed.
Fails if: The selected feature fails to be placed.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

features.title: Features
features.description: Collection of weighted features that placement will select from.

items.title: Feature
items.description: Named reference to a feature.

items.title: Feature
items.description: Named reference to a feature.

items.title: Weight
items.description: Weight used in random selection. Value is relative to other weights in the collection.

A.title: Features 1.13.0
A.description: Features are decorations scattered throughout the world. Things such as trees, plants, flowers, springs, ore, and coral are all features. Basically, if it isn't the terrain or a mob, it's probably a feature!

format_version.description: Specifies the version of the game this entity was made in. Minimum supported version is 1.13.0. Current supported version is 1.13.0.
format_version.title: Format Version

CH.title: Format Version
CH.description: A version that tells minecraft what type of data format can be expected when reading this file.
